value:
{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21708v1", "title": "Computing Polynomial Representation in Subrings of Multivariate
  Polynomial Rings", "summary": "Let $\mathcal{R} = \mathbb{K}[x_1, \dots, x_n]$ be a multivariate polynomial
ring over a field $\mathbb{K}$ of characteristic 0. Consider $n$ algebraically
independent elements $g_1, \dots, g_n$ in $\mathcal{R}$. Let $\mathcal{S}$
denote the subring of $\mathcal{R}$ generated by $g_1, \dots, g_n$, and let $h$
be an element of $\mathcal{S}$. Then, there exists a unique element ${f} \in
\mathbb{K}[u_1, \dots, u_n]$ such that $h = f(g_1, \dots, g_n)$.
  In this paper, we provide an algorithm for computing ${f}$, given $h$ and
$g_1, \dots, g_n$. The complexity of our algorithm is linear in the size of the
input, $h$ and $g_1, \dots, g_n$, and polynomial in $n$ when the degree of $f$
is fixed. Previous works are mostly known when $f$ is a symmetric polynomial
and $g_1, \dots, g_n$ are elementary symmetric, homogeneous symmetric, or power
symmetric polynomials.", "main_category": "cs.SC", "categories": "cs.SC,cs.CC,math.AG", "published": "2025-04-30T14:52:31Z"}
